qas.question: The gradual spread of Buddhism exposed it to a variety of influences including what civilization?
Who was the Greek king immortalized in Buddhist canon?

context: The gradual spread of Buddhism into adjacent areas meant that it came into contact with new ethnical groups. During this period Buddhism was exposed to a variety of influences, from <a0_0>Persian and Greek<a0_0/> civilization, to changing trends in non-Buddhist Indian religions—themselves influenced by Buddhism. Striking examples of this syncretistic development can be seen in the emergence of Greek-speaking Buddhist monarchs in the Indo-Greek Kingdom, and in the development of the Greco-Buddhist art of Gandhāra. A Greek king, <a1_0>Menander<a1_0/>, has even been immortalized in the Buddhist canon.
